item.summary: Add use cases showing move from IEEE to FHIR - 2018-Jan PoCD #1

details.p: Develop use cases based on the IEEE standards that have been published (e.g. implantable caridac devices) to demonstrate how to move from IEEE to FHIR.
Add use cases showing move from IEEE to FHIR

resolution.p: Agree with the suggestion for adding such examples.

comment.p: This is a sound suggestion. Not sure that IDCO can be used as the fullest example, though. Consider alternatives.
Not yet applied in September ballot IG, so this still remains to be done as part of the general strengthening of examples that is intended.

item.summary: Explain why PoCD uses Device and PHD doesn't - 2018-Jan PoCD #2

details.p: The PHD IG does not use the FHIR resource Device but the POCD does. An explanation as to why the difference particularly since there should be correlation between the two IGs would be helpful.
Explain why PoCD uses Device and PHD doesn't

resolution.p: Not timely to respond. Device resource undergoing extensive reconsideration in Orders and Observations - DEV WG will respond to this suggestion once the next iteration of the model is settled

comment.p: Question considered, and a suggested resolution arrived at, as part of Personal Health Device Implementation Guide comment resolution. Intention is to change that Guide to use Device. This does not require a change to this Point-of-Care Implementation Guide.
Changes in the Device resource since FHIR STU3 have changed this situation in the PHD IG, resolving this issue.

item.summary: Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array - 2018-Jan PoCD #3

details.p: The PHD IG uses Real-Time-Sample-Array whereas this IG uses Sample Array. Is there a reason for the variation, and if so, please provide an explanation.
Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array

resolution.p: The PHD Implementation Guide limits itself to Real-Time Sample Arrays. This Implementation Guide (PoCD) contemplates the use other subclasses of Sample Arrays. The difference is intentional. Will add clarifying comment.

item.summary: Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array - 2018-Jan PoCD #4

details.p: The PHD IG uses Real-Time-Sample-Array whereas this IG uses Sample Array. Is there a reason for the variation, and if so, please provide an explanation.
Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array

resolution.p: This is a duplicate of [#15336].

comment.p: PHD has chosen to limit usage to Real-Time Sample Array. In PoCD, there are other subtypes of Sample Array that are allowed to be used, for example for trends. The difference is intentional and useful.

details.p: Existing Wording: The Rosetta Terminology Mapping Management System (RTMMS) lists available codes.
Proposed Wording: The Rosetta Terminology Mapping Management System (RTMMS) lists available codes to select from and for future mapping.
Is Rosetta providing an enumeration type function or a mapping solution or both?
Reword Rosetta Terminology Mapping Management System explanation

resolution.p: This matter is discussed elsewhere in the IG, but putting an expanded explanation where suggested is a good idea, and will be done.

comment.p: In September ballot version of IG, a reorganization of material includes a fuller and clearer explanation of RTMMS in the Terminology section.

details.p: Existing Wording: 1. Patient-Device Associaiton Management Use Case (including IHE PCD PCIM and DMC profiles)
Proposed Wording: 1. Patient-Device Association Management Use Case (including IHE PCD PCIM and DMC profiles)

resolution.p: Auto-approved

comment.p: This item has been removed from the 2018 September IG, so no longer applicable.

item.summary: Use Cases Should Support Full use of the Profiled Resources - 2018-Jan PoCD #7

details.p: Submitted by: Todd Cooper (Trusted Solutions Foundry)

When filling out the use cases in this section, not only the normal device use cases should be included (e.g., for reporting content to the enterprise) but also those that clearly motivate the need to include both Device resource content as well as those for DeviceComponent and DeviceMetric. Many systems in reporting scenarios omit the non-device metric content and only support Patient-Observation association for values. Devices on FHIR enables a whole new class of device-content-enabled applications.
Use Cases Should Support Full use of the Profiled Resources

resolution.p: Agreed. This important concept needs emphasis and explanation.

comment.p: Not resolved in September 2018 IG. Retain the comment and resolve in future use case descriptions.

element.name: _created_
element.new: Use Cases Should Support Full use of the Profiled Resources - 2018-Jan PoCD #7

element.name: resolution
element.new: Agreed. This important concept needs emphasis and explanation.

item.summary: Remove DeviceComponent.languageCode in favor of Resource.language - 2018-Jan PoCD #8

details.p: Submitted by: Todd Cooper (Trusted Solutions Foundry)
Proposed Wording: Remove and use Resource.language instead

DeviceComponent has a languageCode element that indicates the language for human-readable text strings. There is also a language element, which all resources inherit from the base Resource definition. What is the purpose of the additional DeviceComponent.languageCode element? I recommend using Resource.language instead.
Remove DeviceComponent.languageCode in favor of Resource.language

resolution.p: Agree - languageCode here is not useful

comment.p: DeviceComponent resource no longer in use, so this is moot.

element.name: _created_
element.new: Remove DeviceComponent.languageCode in favor of Resource.language - 2018-Jan PoCD #8

item.summary: Change DeviceMetric.color & DeviceComponent Channel profile color extension to have a data type of CodeableConcept - 2018-Jan PoCD #9

details.p: Submitted by: Todd Cooper (Trusted Solutions Foundry)
Existing Wording: DeviceMetric.color data element & DeviceComponent channel profile have a type of "code" bound to DeviceMetricColor
Proposed Wording: Change from "code" to CodeableConcept but an extensible binding to DeviceMetricColor.

DeviceMetric.color and the devicecomponent-color extension are of type code and have a required binding to the DeviceMetricColor value set, which defines only 8 different colors. This is quite limiting. I suggest changing the data type to CodeableConcept with an extensible binding to DeviceMetricColor.
Change DeviceMetric.color & DeviceComponent Channel profile color extension to have a data type of CodeableConcept

resolution.p: Accept the change to a codeable concept to permit a wider range of choices than the very restrictive current code

comment.p: Tentative resolution suggested at 2018-02-19 PoCD subgroup meeting for vote of full group: Accept the change to a codeable concept to permit a wider range of choices than the very restrictive current code
DeviceComponent resource no longer used after STU3. The change needs to be applied in DeviceMetric.

item.summary: Loosen selected bindings to a value set vs. a Fixed Value - 2018-Jan PoCD #10

details.p: Submitted by: Todd Cooper (Trusted Solutions Foundry)
Existing Wording: Fixed value constraint on coding.system
Proposed Wording: Change to an extensible binding to an 11073 MDC value set.

In the PoCD profiles, change Device.type, DeviceComponent.type, DeviceMetric.type, DeviceMetric.unit, Observation.code, and Observation.component.code to an extensible binding to a 11073 MDC value set instead of the fixed value constraint on coding.system. This allows using an alternative code system (e. g. proposed or private 11073 codes) if the 11073 MDC code system does not cover the concept.
Loosen selected bindings to a value set vs. a Fixed Value

resolution.p: Persuasive. This is useful in the case where no MDC code exists, for example a new proprietary observation. Refer to extensible bindings permitting this.

item.summary: Field udi: Why is udi separate from identifier ? Shouldn't udi be included with identifiers.Field udi: Why is udi separate from identifier ? Shouldn't udi be included with identifiers.

details.p: Field udi: Why is udi separate from identifier ? Shouldn't udi be included with identifiers.
Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array

resolution.p: UDI is a multicomponent entry. It is not suitable to use as an identifier. Serial number is included singly as an identifier
Note: summary was changed because old summary actually corresponded to a different comment

element.name: _created_
element.new: Why does PoCD use Sample Array while PHD uses Real-Time Sample Array - 2018-Jan PoCD #12

element.name: resolution

element.new:
UDI is a multicomponent entry. It is not suitable to use as an identifier. Serial number is included singly as an identifier

item.summary: Add to status field values: "paused", "onine", "offline" - 2018-Jan PoCD #13

details.p: Field status: Would like to have "paused" or "idle" status unless it can be reasonably mapped to active and inactive. Same is true of "online", "offline". This would be useful perhaps for gateway-interfaced devices

resolution.p: We cannot change it at the IG level but rather at the Device resource definition level. Device resource definition as part of the proposal for merging Device and Device Component can contain extensions to address this - codable concept with extensible binding.

comment.p: As has been noted, this is a Device resource issue rather than an IG issue. These items have been added to the new statusReason field for the Device resource in post- STU3 version of resource, so this tracker has been set as "applied" (even though the solution was in the resource rather than the IG.

element.name: _created_
element.new: Add to status field values: "paused", "onine", "offline" - 2018-Jan PoCD #13

element.name: resolution
element.new: We cannot change it at the IG level but rather at the Device resource definition level. Device resource definition as part of the proposal for merging Device and Device Component can contain extensions to address this - codable concept with extensible binding.

element.name: resolution
element.new: We cannot change it at the IG level but rather at the Device resource definition level. Device resource definition as part of the proposal for merging Device and Device Component can contain extensions to address this - codable concept with extensible binding.

item.summary: How is a "gateway" identified - 2018-Jan PoCD #14

details.p: Are there any first class attributes of this profile making the distinction between a device interfaced via a Gateway or a device directly connecting.

resolution.p: Given the design and terms of reference of the Point-of-Care Device Implementation Guide, which is about the original device data, the matter of gateways which are not generating or modifying data is out of scope (this is different from the Personal Health Device Implementation design goals, where the role of the gateway is active in time management, etc.). There is another potential use case for the complete "audit trail" of systems involved in transmitting device data which requires different modeling.

comment.p: 2018-03-14 DoF meeting

re: Harmonization with PHD - Gateway plays only minor role, coordinates "coincident time stamps", has own structure definition linked via DeviceComponent, (Brian: should be linked from Observation because gateways is the source of the timestamp - Observation more directly affected, via timestamp). Optional extra detail.
On Point-of-Care devices, gateway minor in its effects on data, not clear what a useful way to include it would be
Needs further analysis
2018-03-19 DoF Point-of-Care subgroup meeting

This implementation guide was designed to reflect device information rather than model the entire data flow from physical device to end use. The "trail" of the data from the device to the final use, potentially throught multiple systems, has difference data needs and may be better modeled separately as a matter of complete data provenance. This is out of scope of the current implementation guide.
2018-03-19 DoF Point-of-Care subgroup meeting

This implementation guide was designed to reflect device information rather than model the entire data flow from physical device to end use. The "trail" of the data from the device to the final use, potentially throught multiple systems, has difference data needs and may be better modeled separately as a matter of complete data provenance. This is out of scope of the current implementation guide.

element.new: Given the design and terms of reference of the Point-of-Care Device Implementation Guide, which is about the original device data, the matter of gateways which are not generating or modifying data is out of scope (this is different from the Personal Health Device Implementation design goals, where the role of the gateway is active in time management, etc.). There is another potential use case for the complete "audit trail"  of systems involved in transmitting device data which requires different modeling.

There is another potential use case for the complete "audit trail"  of systems involved in transmitting device data which requires different modeling.

item.summary: If system both storing and exposing Device data, should there be another "Source"? - 2018-Jan PoCD #15

details.p: What are the expectations for systems storing but also exposing Device data ? Should they provide another "source" element
If system both storing and exposing Device data, should there be another "Source"?

resolution.p: Outside the scope of the current IG (data repositories or devices containing repositories not considered. Consider in possible related future IG.

comment.p: 2018-03-19 Devices on FHIR Point of Care Device Subgroup meeting

This IG is designed for representing device data rather than data repositories or devices with contained repositories, so this topic is currently out of scope. This is for possible consideration in a future implementation guide. Suggested resolution entered for vote in the larger DoF meeting.

item.summary: operationalStatus should be modeled as IEEE 11073 concept - 2018-Jan PoCD #16

details.p: Would like to be modeled as IEEE 11073 concept. If no such things already exists, move to create it in RTMMS.
operationalStatus should be modeled as IEEE 11073 concept

resolution.p: The comment is consistent with the intention of the PoCD Implementation Guide. The future work that is indicated is development of codeSystem/valueSet to conveniently represent the semantics of the 11073-10101 operationStatus for VMD and Channel, potentially with reference to the way these concepts are managed in IHE Patient Care Device Medical Equipment Management - Device Management Communication (MEM-DMC).

element.new: operationalStatus should be modeled as IEEE 11073 concept - 2018-Jan PoCD #16

element.name: resolution
element.new: The comment is consistent with the intention of the PoCD Implementation Guide. The future work that is indicated is development of codeSystem/valueSet to conveniently represent the semantics of the 11073-10101 operationStatus for VMD and Channel, potentially with reference to the way these concepts are managed in IHE Patient Care Device Medical Equipment Management - Device Management Communication (MEM-DMC).

item.summary: DeviceComponent languageCode field not needed - 2018-Jan PoCD #17

details.p: Language code for the human-readable text strings produced by the device
The language code for the human-readable text string produced by the device. This language code will follow the IETF language tag. Example: en-US.

Not seeing or understanding the value of this field. I believe text coming out of devices, which should all be treated as Measurements, should be derived/inferred from a standards dictionary like IEEE 11073 set. Applications would then simply translate according to local/onsite requirements.

resolution.p: Accepted - see also 15341 with essentially the same conclusion
However, DeviceComponent resource has been deprecated, so no change required

Field "color" should use more appropriate coding scheme

item.summary: Field "identifier" should be conditional or removed - 2018-Jan PoCD #19

details.p: The value of DeviceMetric.identifier field should be conditional if that field is event needed.

If needed, then it should come from the DeviceMetric.source or DeviceMetric.parent. If still not appropriate, then at least it should based off the DeviceMetric.category field. Namely, if the category is Measurement, then this is not necessary to fill. If category is settings, then perhaps set. DeviceMetrics are expected to be included in all Observations which significantly adds to the payload footprint.
Field "identifier" should be conditional or removed

resolution.p: Persuasive, already done.

comment.p: This is a duplicate of GF#13287, which requests changing DeviceMetric.identifier cardinality to 0..*. Already applied in current build.

I've re-opened this because you can't mark a ballot item as a duplicate of a non-ballot item that was resolved prior to the ballot opening. Suggest finding it persuasive and noting that it's already been applied.

item.summary: Add dataType field - 2018-Jan PoCD #20

details.p: Would like to see a new field: dataType for DeviceMetric. Instead of relying on the meta/profile field, where a URL is set as value, why not put a first class field called dataType to ease the implementation.

resolution.p: Agree with the general idea, with the following change:
Suggest naming it class (rather than dataType) and using existing IEEE 11073 nomenclature for it.

comment.p: DoF PoCD meeting - 2018-04-16 S. Karl, K. Matsumoto, G. Dixon, M. Faughn, J. Garguilo

Agree. Consensus is that on balance, the advantages of adding a dataType value justify maintaining the additional field - it provides a simple discrimination of dataType not depending on more complicated and potentially less universal and reliable methods.
Suggest naming it class (rather than dataType) and using existing IEEE 11073 nomenclature for it.
Still requires a change to the DeviceMetric resource.

element.new:

Suggest naming it class (rather than dataType) and using existing IEEE 11073 nomenclature for it.

resolution.p: Suggestion accepted: this is already covered technically in the definition of the Enumeration Observation in the IG, but it can be explicitly mentioned in the general discussion of observations in the IG.

comment.p: This is already suppoorted: see the definition of the Enumeration Observation profile in the IG. An explicit mention of this can also be added in an appropriate point in the general discussion of observations.

item.summary: Additional use cases suggested - 2018-Jan PoCD #22

details.p: Example 1: patient in critical but stable condition needs to be transferred to more equipped or specialized health facility. Base line monitoring prior to transfer, during transfer and after transfer can or should occur. Access via FHIR of all contextual data and device producing data can connect all stages of this care journey.
Example 2: Ambulatory clinics with already enabled EMR integration can help reduce implementation costs by forgoing additional system and network infrastructure via FHIR based transports.

resolution.p: Agree -additional use cases will be included

item.summary: Missing ValueSets referenced - 2018-Jan PoCD #34

details.p: Submitted by: Eric Haas (eHealth Data, Inc.)

Missing ValueSets described in the code system section, "Device.type and DeviceComponent.type shall be present and have a coding from the 11073 MDC device nomenclature. This should ensure consistent coding using the ISO/IEEE 11073-10101 Nomenclature standard, which provides MDS, VMD, and Channel codes for device models according to the 11073-10201 DIM. As these elements are of type CodeableConcept there can be additional coding from other code systems.
Same for the DeviceMetric.type, which shall have a coding from the 11073 MDC metrics nomenclature.

resolution.p: Agreed. Incomplete without this.

comment.p: ValueSets have been defined, but since CodeSystem is still under construction, they can not yet be expanded.

item.summary: IG format made it difficult to review - 2018-Jan PoCD #35

details.p: This guide was very difficult to review. Would use the format used by other FHIR IGs to make this IG more readable and easier to understand. Especially where many of the individual pages are empty or have just a sentence or two of text (such as in the Home menu, Use Cases), it would be better if they were consolidated into one.
IG format made it difficult to review

resolution.p: Formatting - suggestion conveyed to toolmaker

comment.p: Move from Simplifier to IG Publisher has been done. Some suggested addition and editing of text suggested remains to be done.

element.name: _created_
element.new: IG format made it difficult to review - 2018-Jan PoCD #35

item.summary: Reword Overview text - 2018-Jan PoCD #36

details.p: Existing Wording: This implementation Guide provides point-of-care device data organized according to the IEEE 11073-10201 Domain Information Model (DIM), to provide a framework for enriching the numeric and waveform observations with context not provided by the FHIR Observation Resource and the Device Resource by themselves. The context is to allow a receiving system to determine attributes of the device system and its subsystems that bear on the interpretation of the observations.

Proposed Wording: This implementation Guide provides a framework for enriching the numeric and waveform observations from point-of-care devices based on the IEEE 11073-10201 Domain Information Model (DIM), in order to provide context that is not included in the primary FHIR Observation or Device Resources. This will allow receiving systems to determine the attributes of the device system and its subsystems that bear on the interpretation of the observations.

resolution.p: Wording to be changed as suggested

item.summary: typo - 2018-Jan PoCD #37

details.p: Using the DIM allows tracking down an observation the precise instrument, module, and channel that originated it.
Using the DIM allows tracking down an observation to the precise instrument, module, and channel that originated it.

resolution.p: Auto-approved

item.summary: Terminology resources incomplete - 2018-Jan PoCD #38

details.p: This value set includes codes from the following code systems:
No values are provided in the "Value set", and neither of the URLs (http://devices.fhir.org/ValueSet/measurement-status, http://devices.fhir.org/CodeSystem/measurement-status) work.

resolution.p: Accepted - omissions will be corrected

item.summary: Explain relationship between this IG and the PHD IG - 2018-Jan PoCD #39

details.p: On the overview for balloting page it is requested that we review both this IG and the PHD IG and comment on alignment/harmonization opportunities. Would be helpful to understand at a high level how the two are related, how they are different, and why they use completely different profiles (with one exception I think). In cases of overlap or where there are specific key differences, it would be helpful to have references/links to the other to quickly jump back and forth to compare them.
Explain relationship between this IG and the PHD IG

resolution.p: Accepted -will add the requested content

element.name: _created_
element.new: Explain relationship between this IG and the PHD IG - 2018-Jan PoCD #39

item.summary: Clarify requirement (or not) for MDC code - 2018-Jan PoCD #40

details.p: Existing Wording: Observation.code and, for compound metrics, Observation.component.code shall have a coding from the ISO/IEEE 11073 MDC metrics nomenclature.

This profile is not described (in Title) as derived from 11073 or Continua. Requiring an MDC code here is forcing otherwise conformant device driven profiles to adapt 11073. Is this always the case? Should the IG title reflect the dependance on MDC?
Clarify requirement (or not) for MDC code

resolution.p: The IG as a whole is aligned with IEEE 11073 concepts and nomenclature, but is general in nature (therefore we do not agree that MDC should be included in the title of the IG). In the case of measured observations, it is appropriate to give in addition, equivalent codes from familiar systems such as LOINC or SNOMED, but the IEEE 11073-10101 codes are a fundamental part of giving a consistent structure of data in the model and SHALL is appropriate for inclusion of such codes.

comment.p: 2018-02-19 Conference call - Devices PoCD group (Rhoads, S. Karl, M. Faughn present), for recommended resolutions: this comment brings up a key issue: the degree to which this profile is tied to IEEE 11073 Domain Information Model and Nomenclature. The consensus of this group is that the IG is structured around these things, so this is a SHALL (though other systems such as LOINC or SNOMED may be used in addition).

element.name: _created_
element.new: Clarify requirement (or not) for MDC code - 2018-Jan PoCD #40

element.name: resolution
element.new: The IG as a whole is aligned with IEEE 11073 concepts and nomenclature, but is general in nature (therefore we do not agree that MDC should be included in the title of the IG). In the case of measured observations, it is appropriate to give in addition, equivalent codes from familiar systems such as LOINC or SNOMED, but the IEEE 11073-10101 codes are a fundamental part of giving a consistent structure of data in the model and SHALL is appropriate for inclusion of such codes.

element.name: resolution
element.new: The IG as a whole is aligned with IEEE 11073 concepts and nomenclature, but is general in nature (therefore we do not agree that MDC should be included in the title of the IG). In the case of measured observations, it is appropriate to give in addition, equivalent codes from familiar systems such as LOINC or SNOMED, but the IEEE 11073-10101 codes are a fundamental part of giving a consistent structure of data in the model and SHALL is appropriate for inclusion of such codes.

item.summary: Measurement status should be an extension on DeviceMetric - 2018-Jan PoCD #41

details.p: Measurement status extension combines metaphors, overloading observation status with device status. The two concepts should be separated and attached to the relevant resources - in this case, most of the measurement status enumerations refer to operatin status of the devcie, not status of the observation (which are already covered by observation.status). Measurement status seems more appropriate as an extension on DevcieMetric. Please consolidate this with the PHD effort, which has eliminated the notion of a DeviceMetric.
Measurement status should be an extension on DeviceMetric

resolution.p: Expected changes in the Device resource, reflecting the deletion of the DeviceComponent and a refactoring of fields and harmonization with Personal Health Devices IG, will make this matter more or less moot. The following is quoted from an email of 2018-07-24 from Stefan Karl gives an indication
"I made a request (16231) for changing cardinality of Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation from 0..1 to 0..* to allow multiple interpretations.
With these changes, the following mapping of the MeasurementStatus bits could be done:

“invalid”, “not-available”, and “msmt-ongoing” can be mapped to Observation.dataAbsentReason and Observation.component.dataAbsentReason elements with appropriate values (e. g., “error”, “not-performed”, “temp-unknown”).

“questionable”, “calibration-ongoing”, “early-indication”, “msmt-state-in-alarm”, and “msmt-state-al-inhibited” (or for PHD “msmt-value-exceed-boundaries” and “msmt-state-ann-inhibited”) can be mapped to Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation, which requires extending the observation-interpretation value set. This conforms to the IHE PCD mapping of measurement status to OBX-8 and OBX-11, and FHIR mapping of OBX-8 to interpretation.
If data validation is supported, “validated-data” can be expressed by Observation.status “final” vs. “preliminary”. This conforms to FHIR mapping of OBX-11 to status.
“test-data” and “demo-data” can be indicated by Observation.meta.security set to “HTEST”. For an overall device “demo” mode the Device and DeviceMetric resources can get this meta tag as well.
Now everything is in the Observation resource, which serves the need for PHD modeling without DeviceMetric."

comment.p: Persuasive with modification - the current measurementStatus concept comes from IEEE 11073-10201 Domain Information Model and contains semantic elements beyond what we think is appropriately covered by observation.status. The -10201 concept has elements that probably fit will with observation.status, but we wish to review the "semantic clusters" that may be combined in the -10201 concept and determine which ones may need to be kept separate from Observation and those that do not (Stefan Karl will propose a specific treatment). Commenter will be invited to discuss this.
The current extension value set is based on the 11073-10201 definition of measurement status, which is part of each observed value (also for components of a compound metric).
As an alternative, most of the measurement status flags can be mapped to existing elements:
- "invalid", "not-available", and "msmt-ongoing" to Observation.dataAbsentReason and Observation.component.dataAbsentReason with appropriate values;
- "questionable" and "early-indication" to Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation, which requires extending the observation-interpretation value set;
- "validated-data" can be expressed by Observation.status "final" vs. "preliminary";
- "calibration-ongoing" can be added to DeviceMetric.calibration.state, which needs a change of the metric-calibration-state value set;
- "test-data" and "demo-data" can be added to DeviceMetric.operationalStatus, which needs a change of the metric-operational-status value set.
There is no good place for "msmt-state-in-alarm" and "msmt-state-al-inhibited", because alarm related information is not covered by current FHIR specification.
Comment only partially accepted. Another discussion, with commenter (Dale Nelson) present, needed.

Expected changes in the Device resource, reflecting the deletion of the DeviceComponent and a refactoring of fields and harmonization with Personal Health Devices IG, will make this matter more or less moot. The following is quoted from an email of 2018-07-24 from Stefan Karl gives an indication
"I made a request (16231) for changing cardinality of Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation from 0..1 to 0..* to allow multiple interpretations.
With these changes, the following mapping of the MeasurementStatus bits could be done:

“invalid”, “not-available”, and “msmt-ongoing” can be mapped to Observation.dataAbsentReason and Observation.component.dataAbsentReason elements with appropriate values (e. g., “error”, “not-performed”, “temp-unknown”).

“questionable”, “calibration-ongoing”, “early-indication”, “msmt-state-in-alarm”, and “msmt-state-al-inhibited” (or for PHD “msmt-value-exceed-boundaries” and “msmt-state-ann-inhibited”) can be mapped to Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation, which requires extending the observation-interpretation value set. This conforms to the IHE PCD mapping of measurement status to OBX-8 and OBX-11, and FHIR mapping of OBX-8 to interpretation.
If data validation is supported, “validated-data” can be expressed by Observation.status “final” vs. “preliminary”. This conforms to FHIR mapping of OBX-11 to status.
“test-data” and “demo-data” can be indicated by Observation.meta.security set to “HTEST”. For an overall device “demo” mode the Device and DeviceMetric resources can get this meta tag as well.
Now everything is in the Observation resource, which serves the need for PHD modeling without DeviceMetric."
This has been done in September ballot version of IG.

element.new:
Expected changes in the Device resource, reflecting the deletion of the DeviceComponent and a refactoring of fields and harmonization with Personal Health Devices IG, will make this matter more or less moot. The following is quoted from an email of 2018-07-24 from Stefan Karl gives an indication 

"I made a request (16231) for changing cardinality of Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation from 0..1 to 0..* to allow multiple interpretations.

 

With these changes, the following mapping of the MeasurementStatus bits could be done:

“invalid”, “not-available”, and “msmt-ongoing” can be mapped to Observation.dataAbsentReason and Observation.component.dataAbsentReason elements with appropriate values (e. g., “error”, “not-performed”, “temp-unknown”).

“questionable”, “calibration-ongoing”, “early-indication”, “msmt-state-in-alarm”, and “msmt-state-al-inhibited” (or for PHD “msmt-value-exceed-boundaries” and “msmt-state-ann-inhibited”) can be mapped to Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation, which requires extending the observation-interpretation value set. This conforms to the IHE PCD mapping of measurement status to OBX-8 and OBX-11, and FHIR mapping of OBX-8 to interpretation.

If data validation is supported, “validated-data” can be expressed by Observation.status “final” vs. “preliminary”. This conforms to FHIR mapping of OBX-11 to status.

“test-data” and “demo-data” can be indicated by Observation.meta.security set to “HTEST”. For an overall device “demo” mode the Device and DeviceMetric resources can get this meta tag as well.

Now everything is in the Observation resource, which serves the need for PHD modeling without DeviceMetric."

Expected changes in the Device resource, reflecting the deletion of the DeviceComponent and a refactoring of fields and harmonization with Personal Health Devices IG, will make this matter more or less moot. The following is quoted from an email of 2018-07-24 from Stefan Karl gives an indication 

"I made a request (16231) for changing cardinality of Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation from 0..1 to 0..* to allow multiple interpretations.

 

With these changes, the following mapping of the MeasurementStatus bits could be done:

“invalid”, “not-available”, and “msmt-ongoing” can be mapped to Observation.dataAbsentReason and Observation.component.dataAbsentReason elements with appropriate values (e. g., “error”, “not-performed”, “temp-unknown”).

“questionable”, “calibration-ongoing”, “early-indication”, “msmt-state-in-alarm”, and “msmt-state-al-inhibited” (or for PHD “msmt-value-exceed-boundaries” and “msmt-state-ann-inhibited”) can be mapped to Observation.interpretation and Observation.component.interpretation, which requires extending the observation-interpretation value set. This conforms to the IHE PCD mapping of measurement status to OBX-8 and OBX-11, and FHIR mapping of OBX-8 to interpretation.

If data validation is supported, “validated-data” can be expressed by Observation.status “final” vs. “preliminary”. This conforms to FHIR mapping of OBX-11 to status.

“test-data” and “demo-data” can be indicated by Observation.meta.security set to “HTEST”. For an overall device “demo” mode the Device and DeviceMetric resources can get this meta tag as well.

Now everything is in the Observation resource, which serves the need for PHD modeling without DeviceMetric."

item.summary: Measurement status should be modifier extension in DeviceMetric - 2018-Jan PoCD #42

details.p: Notwithstanding the comment above, whereever the Measurement Statsu extension used used, it probably needs to be a modifier extension in that it purports to hold non-ignorable status.
Measurement status should be modifier extension in DeviceMetric

resolution.p: This is related to [#15374], and in seeking a solution to the problem discussed there, we will take this comment into account, but wish to avoid having this be defined as a modifier extension because of the limits this places on interoperability.

comment.p: This is related to [#15374], and in seeking a solution to the problem discussed there, we will take this comment into account, but wish to avoid having this be defined as a modifier extension because of the limits this places on interoperability.
See also 2018-07-24 comment on proposed resolution of related issue [#15374]
See [#15374]. Changes made make it no longer necessary for this to be an extension.

details.p: Submitted by: Kanwarpreet Sethi (Lantana Consulting Group)

Please fix the stylesheet associated with this IG. It should render in a similar fashion to other FHIR IGs. Look at US Core for an example. item.summary: Consider "must support" flag on items such as the identifiers - 2018-Jan PoCD #45

details.p: Submitted by: Kanwarpreet Sethi (Lantana Consulting Group)
Please consider using the "must support" flag on items such as the identifiers
Consider "must support" flag on items such as the identifiers

resolution.p: Agree with the general point that "mustSupport" deserves to be considered in design of a profile. Do not agree in the particular case the commenter suggests.
Meaning of "must support" flag is indefinite without specific anaysis in the description of a particular profile, and this must be made clear in an implementation guide.

Its application must be considered on a case by case basis - restrict "must support" to cases where it is really needed - it has the potential to unnecessarily restrict interoperability in other cases.
In the case of identifiers we do not see a strong case for it. Other cases where it might be useful could include operationalStatus in DeviceComponent or DeviceMetric.

comment.p: (Referred for further study by IG authoring group)

Consensus of PoCD Tech Monday morning discussion is that this must be considered on a cases by cases basis and to restrict "must support" to cases where it is really needed - it has the potential to unnecessarily restrict interoperability in other cases.
Still do not agree with specific suggestion, but ought to be considered for application to other items. Changed to "Resolved, change required".

element.new:
Agree with the general point that "mustSupport" deserves to be considered in design of a profile. Do not agree in the particular case the commenter suggests.

Meaning of "must support" flag is indefinite without specific anaysis in the description of a particular profile, and this must be made clear in an implementation guide.

Its application must be considered on a case by case basis - restrict "must support" to cases where it is really needed - it has the potential to unnecessarily restrict interoperability in other cases.

In the case of identifiers we do not see a strong case for it. Other cases where it might be useful could include operationalStatus in DeviceComponent or DeviceMetric.

element.name: resolution
